The choice of ticket purchase also affects whether you can sit at a real serving or just buy a cheap copy of a Singapore Sling drink in a simpler kiosk. Regardless, it is worth the money, time and effort to get up here and enjoy the beautiful city - try to hit the time around sunset, when the light is at its best!

REVIEW_TITLE: Only 10% of the roof is accessible
REVIEW_BODY: Once we arrived on the top we realised that we were limited to a very small proportion of the deck, about 10%. The remaining 90% is not accessible. So, you can not have a 360° view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Observation deck entry v bar entry
REVIEW_BODY:
Online observation deck entry includes tea drink for 20% off vs free entry Bar but with minimum charge. It's misleading to think the bar entry is free since both work out to be similar in cost.

Both have limited access to the top deck. With the bar, you are also limited by where you get seated. The outermost seats are still behind the observation deck. At the northern end, the observation deck extends at least 20 meters away from where the bar seating ends.

YMMV

Best place to unwind when in Singapore. Marina Bay Sands is equipped with literally everything from luxury shopping malls to roof top discos and casinos too. sky deck is always my first choice to unwind and enjoy the best view of the Singapore Skyline. The music and the ambiance are both fabulous.

REVIEW_TITLE: Excellent view of the city, but expensive
REVIEW_BODY: A must do in Singapore, but very expensive, circa $20 for a standard beer. Cost $20 each to get up to the top, which can be used as credit to purchase drinks, food etc up the top.

REVIEW_TITLE: Perfect if only for the views
REVIEW_BODY: Ate at ace La Vie restaurant and whilst we couldn’t fault the food it is a bit pricy and aimed at tourists. However the view by night is to die for!

Something you must do to say you have done. Views are beautiful and a must see but once you have looked around there is not much else to see. I’m sure you could pay extra to go to the pool area but we didn’t. Would be better if you could use your pass all day as would be good to come back at night and see the lights of the city but it is stay as long as you like but only once. Glad I did it but won’t go again.
Everyone has already probably said it so I won’t harp on too much, but without sounding too cliche..... it’s a must do, no crowds, stinkin hot and wow what a view.

REVIEW_TITLE: I think I am Going to Stay Here Next Time
REVIEW_BODY: Spectacular views! We want to stay here next time in Singapore. Too bad we did not visit the pool...

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice to visit, but hard to get vantage points
REVIEW_BODY:
Visited at cost, with that charge credited toward food and drink, which are expensive.
Great views, but hard to get vantage points.

Unhindered views of city, marina and gardens by the bay.

Enjoy as hotel guest or buy a ticket.
Restaurant Cie Le Vie located on the deck behind the viewing points.

Located in marina bay sands hotel.
Take lift to 55, located within tower2 lifts.

I decided to go to the sky park only because I was staying at MBS and it is complimentary for hotel guests.

The views here are stunning! You can see the entire city from a 360 degree view, and it was less crowded than I expected it to be. There is also food and drinks up here so no need to grab them beforehand.

I’m glad I didn’t pay for the attraction because I’m not sure it’s worth the cost. It really depends on you though. It’s a fun attraction when it’s free, but I would pick another attractive (gardens by the bay) over this if there had to be a decision made.

Luckily, you can do this pretty quickly so there’s not a ton of time spend up here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Feel on Top of the World
REVIEW_BODY: The Sky Park on 57th floor is an unique experience and offers stunning views of Singapore. One doesn't get tired even after spending many hours. A must visit while in Singapore
The view is outstanding but the price is too high for a simple glimpse of the city from the 56th floor.

This is a picture perfect place.
Enjoy the beautiful view over Singapore.
Bring your foto/video camera!

REVIEW_TITLE: Why go to the SkyPark? Go up to the bar instead!!
REVIEW_BODY:
So many people were spending money to go to the skypark when, for much better value, you can go to Ce La Vie bar on level 57! A simple question at reception revealed you can go up to this classy bar with better views for virtually the same price.
Go to Tower 1 and the Ce La Vie desk on the ground level and purchase a ticket for £11 English pounds. Then go up to level 57 and you use your £11 ticket as credit at the bar for drink or food. For an extra £2 we all enjoyed a fabulous cocktail with a much better atmosphere and incredible views. For the same price there were people just walking around a plain observation deck!!! They seemed completely crazy to us! Additionally, the bar wraps around so you can wander and get various views as well as going right to the edge of the famous infinity pool.
It was an amazing must-do experience in Singapore. Please don't waste your money on the SkyPark - go to Ce La Vie bar instead!
We stayed in the hotel, thus have access to it. It is very crowded during the afternoon. Recommended to go early

I think the photos tell the story
All the attractions are in this area
RED LINE on the metro
Enjoy.
Wear flat comfy shoes..
Lots of walking involved.

REVIEW_TITLE: Quarantined observation deck to keep the plebeians away
REVIEW_BODY:
I get that observation decks provide the most stunning views of city skylines.

When I saw the Marina Bay Sands I could not wait to see the view from the top. I thought $23 was a bit steep but hey, I’m only in Singapore for a day.

Little did I realize this gets you access to a tiny sliver of the north side of the deck. While the view is nice for a bit, there is little room to explore at all.

Oh, and to add insult to injury... they keep the adjacent restaurant sectioned off for guests only. Because you’re not really a guest and god forbid you try to spend your poor-person money at their fancy restaurant.

This place must make so much money in every facet it’s insulting to charge $23 to use an elevator.
We went to the Skypark after dinner on our first night in Singapore and the views were amazing especially overlooking the Gardens by the Bay and the vast number of ships at anchor off shore.

A different way to have a drink; relax and take in the views. We got some lovely views of the city and Gardens. Shame it was a cloudy day.

It costs S$22 pp to gain entrance to the bar / restaurant area at the top but this fee is redeemable against food and drink. A cocktail will set you back around S$23. Food is pricey e.g. S$24 for small plate of prawns. That said, huge numbers of people go there for dinner so clearly popular. Be prepared to have a credit card retained if you’re running a tab. There is a dedicated lift to take you all the way up. You can also pay to gain access to the infinity pool if you want a dip.

Well worth it for the experience

REVIEW_TITLE: A great view of the city
REVIEW_BODY:
Lovely to go to the top of the hotel to the observation desk - it is 57 floors up so the view is incredible.

We got a ticket that included the Singapore sling - not worth it in my opinion.

It's an amazing sky park
In level 57
You can see all around Singapore
There is restaurant and coffee shops
You can spend 4,5 hour's
A visit that is memorable and unforgetable. Love the scenary and the skyline. Singapore looks different and beautiful. Go and experience it before sunset.

REVIEW_TITLE: Awesome but only if you don’t mind heights
REVIEW_BODY:
We were on a 2 night stop over & got tickets from the hotel for the sky park and gardens by the bay . We went via the subway , which the hotel is close too.

The building or 3 towers is just awesome , a real feat of architecture and engineering . The ground floor has two hotel receptions , shops and restaurants & is very busy.

The skypark is at one end and wasn’t that easy to find initially. Staff are on hand to guide you .We went up all 55 floors & the reception area has a toilet and photo shop.

I don’t like heights so was very unnerved by being so high up so had to let my hubby take in the views & take some photos. There is a small cafe selling drinks and a gift shop but there is no where to sit. Clearly they don’t want you to stay up there for for too long. There is a restaurant too but on the day we went it closed at 2 pm

I honestly don’t know how they built this building as it is amazing but don’t expect to see the famous infinity pool as this is only for hotel guests and the skypark is only one end of the top floor so don’t expect to be able to walk around the whole level. The skypark area is surrounded by a tall glass barrier so is safe but you’ve been warned if you don’t like heights think twice, I have never been so scared as I was on this trip.

We pre purchased our tickets from our hotel so we didn’t need to line up. The views are amazing & definitely worth a visit. There is a small cafe at top where you can buy a non alcoholic singapore sling slushie. Refreshing on a hot day.
That is one of the reason why I wanted to travel to Singapore. Amazing infinity pool. I would not call it the best in the world but definitely one of the best :)

A must to obtain an overall view of mainland Singapore. Absolutely amazing how tall this hotel is which offers unrivalled views from shipping, local housing, business towers and the general layout of this vibrant island.

People come here for the fabulous views and it is impressive. Visitors are controlled via elevator and the observation deck is not overcrowded. There is a bar and a souvenir shop but that's about it. The restaurant and bar are reserved for hotel guests but you can obtain a reservation from the concierge in the lobby. The lobby of the hotel is busy with shoppers browsing through high-level shops and restaurants. From the lobby, you can visit the casino as long as you present a passport. Access to the gardens can be gained via upper level elevators and the hop on hop off bus stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel lobby, observation deck, the gardens and the casino are must-see attractions at this location. Don't rush through it!

REVIEW_TITLE: Must visit place especially sunset and night view
REVIEW_BODY:
Excellent view of the city from sands sky park.we visited around 5.30 pm and sat there till 8.00 PM so we can have both day and night views.

We can also see garden by bay light show at 7.45 pm from here but sound will not reach here.
I was a little disappointed with this overpriced attraction. I spent less than 30 minutes there perhaps it would be more attractive if you visit in the evening or night.

We went in the morning and so it was not so busy at the top although it became busier after a while. The views were wonderful and because you can walk around the platform you get almost 360 degree views across Singapore. The ticket only gives access to the viewing platform and not the swimming pool area which is reserved for hotel guests.
You can also enjoy a frozen Singapore Sling as you look across the city.
My only negative (and why I have given this 4 and not 5 stars) is that there were no places to sit and there was not much shade and so, although you can spend as long as you like there, it is not comfortable to do so.
However, I would recommend this to any visitor to Singapore because it's a unique opportunity to view this beautiful city.
Looks good and promising in the day time as well as in the night too. Getting taxi in the night also is not a problem.
Got to see from the top deck and I could see the shore from there.They even put map and explaination for each buildings and monuments close to the glass.
You can´t miss to stay at least one night at this hotel. That is the only way to get in this amazing pool.

REVIEW_TITLE: Like the Maldives on a roof!
REVIEW_BODY:
Beautiful place. If you are a hotel guest access is free. There is a nightclub terrace bar on Tower 3 and a large Italian bar and grill on top of tower 1 in between them there is a giant infinity pool. There are loads of seats and beds in a variety of options, there are jacuzzi pools and observation seats. The pool is huge and split into family zone and adults only. There is an abundance of staff bringing drinks and food to you. In the main concourse area there is a large bar and diner by Wolfgang Puck and you can sit and dine in the main area or the bar anytime.
Above all (excuse the pun!)
To swim to the waters edge and look down 55 stores to the marina below is an experience not to missed. H a cocktail in hand and look down on the forest and gardens behind the hotel is just wonderful.
As with everywhere you go in this hotel, the staff are great. Lots of friendly people more than happy to go the extra mile to make you happy and comfortable
A great place - a must see on your visit to Singapore
The race going above or coming down the 57 storeys was alike an aeroplane landing at high speed. The complete view of the skyline of Singapore can be seen. It is a plce that one should not miss.

My wife and I recently visited Singapore after a cruise from Fremantle. We decided to checkout the Skypark on top of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel to get a good perspective and overview of this beautiful city. After purchasing our tickets we took the lift to the skypark and were certainly not disappointed with the views of Singapore's skyline and the harbour. We then decided to have something to eat at the restaurant adjacent to the skypark, but were informed that we could not enter the restaurant from the skydeck and would have to leave the skypark via the lift and return to a different level before entering this restaurant. This seemed a little bit odd considering there was an entrance via a couple of stairs from the skydeck. We were also informed that once we left the skypark we would not be able to return. Apparently the operators of the 'Skypark' and the adjacent restaurant were not prepared to co-operate, hence the ludicrous decision to prevent people on the skydeck entering the restaurant. For a tourist destination this was a little disappointing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice but not worth the money
REVIEW_BODY:
Ok, you have a good view (but note: you are only at the very end of the terrace (corner towards wheel). But you can only have a beer/dring out of a plastic cup. You can't go to the restaurant/bar. That you have to book/pay separately. Also not vice-versa.
And honetly the hotel itself isn't worth to stay there (too expensive, too crowded).
In other cities like NY you have more to see on such a terrace

The view from the infinity pool is amazing. You can even see the laser show directly from top every evening. Food is good too. There is separate adults only pool. the fact not mentioned on promotions is that its very crowded. That is bound to happen in a hotel with 2500 rooms or so.

We visited the skypark on an organized tour. The views were beautiful but as most of the roof is taken up with the hotel pool we were confined to a tiny section. A bit disappointing but definitely worth the experience
Great views from the top. Clear barrier on the edge to see city skyline and surrounding area. fee is charged.

The most stunning architecture in Singapore and $23 to go up the lift to floor 56 or 57 and what for? We were aware that we wouldn't have access to the pool or hotel areas, but the fact that there wasn't even a decent cafe or bar to enjoy the views from was pretty poor. You could buy a drink in one bar which was basically a counter.
The views were amazing and we got some great photos with the zoom at its bests - photos better than the reality

REVIEW_TITLE: of course, it is a must!
REVIEW_BODY: During our stay at the hote, we came in the morning for a swim and came to the afternoon for sun bathing, drinks...enjoying every minutes of it...

REVIEW_TITLE: No cover for when it rains and not great frozen singapore sling
REVIEW_BODY:
I have to say I am pretty disappointed with our experience .

We bought a ticket for 33 dollars which included a frozen Singapore Sling.
On the day we went it rained and we have been made aware by the staff which was nice . We asked then if we can transfer the ticket to another day but this was not possible ( so what's the point of pointing out the rain as it had been raining all day )

The view on the top is stunning but there is no rain cover at all and we have been told we have to have our cocktail walking around in the rain. Cocktail was a cheap small class of ready made stuff. Not tasty and not worth 7 dollars . Not quite the experience I was looking for.
After making a bit of a fuzz we were aloud to go up the bar and finish our cocktail .
Not a 5 star experience

We had been told that this was a must do in Singapore. We went up tower 3 on a particularly hot and humid day but the views were absolutely worth it. The day was really clear so we could clearly see all around. Highly recommend.

Thought it was a great idea to go to the top for $23 and this included a drink from the bar plus tax - so at the top you can’t go to the observation deck ( different price ) only to the bar area - great view and beautiful at night - very busy which is expected but not really with tourists mostly workers at th end of their day.
There was one downfall where the bar waitstaff were rude and ignorant and I have never been to a bar where the bar staff use their fingers to put the fruit and ice in to your drink - when I questioned this the manager said “I have worked here for 5 years and your the first person to ever ask me that “ enough said !
Been there now done that ! Great view but that’s all it’s got going for it !

Stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for only one night but this place left its mark on me. A beautiful luxurious hotel with comfortable large rooms. Stayed on the 14th floor and had a view to die for with a huge window looking out over the water. Had room service in the evening by the window whilst watching the laser show on the water.
The hotel infinity pool is to die for and was the most incredible experience looking over the edge, soaking up the sun looking out over the beautiful views.

This is a fabulous place and we had drinks at both the bars at the top of tower 1 & 3. At tower 1 it is free to go up and views are excellent. At tower 3 you pay $22 which is redeemed at the bar and their is an additional payment to enter the viewing platform which I don’t think is worthwhile.
Drinks in both bars are expensive as you’d imagine but still worth the visit.

One of the absolute bucket list items of our recent trip to Singapore was the Skypark at Marina Bay Sands. It lived up to our expectations and then some. 360 degree views of the city and harbour were absolutely stunning, including a Birdseye view of the other bucket list item, Gardens by the Bay.
Reasonably priced and easily accessed, it is an absolute must do when in Singapore. A photographers haven, but if you want the professional touch, a professional photographer is on hand and for a reasonable fee, will supply you a selection of amazing shots using green screen technology. Sure it’s cheating but so what, the pictures are impressive.
The views and the Design of the Magnificent Building are worth the price to go to the top.Amazing Architecture.

How could we visit Singapore and not spend a night at the marina bay sands, the rooftop pool was amazing and the perfect temperature, only downside was needing your room card to visit the restroom, cocktails on the roof then dinner at lavo, great service and atmosphere but the meals could be a little more generous. Shopping across the road and casino if thats your thing, then theres the gardens with an amazing light show at night.
This hotel is a sight that has to be seen, modern practical rooms with great views, only downside was after paying a big chunk on our room they wanted to charge us for milk for our coffee as it is not supplied.
Overall 5 stars, just do it.

This was limited - to purchase a ticket I had to use the escelator as there was no lift access. Once at the top the view was magnificant but there were no seats for me to rest and I was on crutches. There was very little shade or shelter either.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place to see the Singapore Skyline
REVIEW_BODY:
We pre purchased the tickets direct from the Marine Sands Hotel web site and also paid for a Singapore Sling slush as part of the package

We visited during the early evening arriving at approx 7pm and found the organisation to be rather chaotic partly due to the large number of people to few staff

When we got to the top we found that you collected the Singapore Sling Slush from a small cafe at the top who also sold other refreshments, there’s also a bar at the top where you can buy alcohol etc.

The views were amazing and we were able to watch the Gardens by The Bay evening show from the top, having seen it the previous evening at ground level, it was equally as impressive

Well worth a visit

Did the must do thing, bought the tickets walked completely through the bottom of the hotel to go to the top to find that you can’t go all the way along the booking platform. Views are good but not worth the money.

Firz was much more polite than the Pinoy lady service at the pool, whom was very rude and cold in answering with a yes & no to my questions and even made me carry my own table to my cabana. I had to checked out by 12.30pm and Firz tried to ensure my angus burger in time despite me ordering at 12pm. Thanks to kitchen and chef too for expediting my order!

No charge for hotel guests and a nominal 20 odd SGD charge otherwise.

Lifts were pretty busy and about 20 people in the evening queue.

Once upstairs you can spend as much time as you like. The private entrance to the infinity pool is key card only - although you can go into the c’est la vie bar no issue.

There is a souvenir shop that also serves food and beverage.

Fantastic views - see the F1 track, gardens, high rise towers and beyond over the bay.

The experience gives a nice aerial view of the city. Be prepared to stand in queue for the lift. Also time your visit such that you are able to see the light & laser show from above. My visit was during the night but I guess the sunset must be beautiful to watch too.

This is the place to get fantastic views, not the giant Ferris wheel. Not cheap but worth it. You get gouged for food and drink too, so bring your own.
Only one negative, there was absolutely no place to sit down, no seats at all, and no shelter from sun or rain ( the restaurant was off-limits to us when we attended) so your stay at the top will be limited by how long your legs hold out. For old people (like me!) I thought that was a bit shabby, even though it is a sneaky way for the operators to ensure people don’t stay all day.
Kim W, Gippsland, Australia
We went up at night on a beautiful still night. Just so lovely able to see both ways. The city lights just great

The MBS is one of the well-known hotel in the world. Especially the infinity pool, a little bit crowd as usual, but once you jump into the pool. It's amazing. A great atmosphere and a good picture to be taken.

Visited and stayed at MBS earlier this year
Went to pool for a swim
It was totally packed by parents children and sightseeing public
Did not enter the water as I had concerns about the quality of the water with the amount of people using the facility
Overall the whole area was full of people and it was not a place to relax or stay for too long
The views from the top are indeed excellent but the whole experience was disappointing and I will not be returning

REVIEW_TITLE: If you don’t live in the hotel you can’t go to the sky park.
REVIEW_BODY: This was a little bit disappointing... Yes, you can buy tickets to go up visit the boat and check the view but if you don’t live in the hotel you have access only to the front/nose of the boat and can’t enjoy the pool or the park.

This is a good view from the top of the Marina bay sands hotel. Just keep in mind that you only have access to the very eastern end, so no taking a dip on the pool. The only downside for me was the price. For a family of 4 it cost $104. A bit expensive I thought for an elevator ride.
it was indeed a breathtaking and fantastic experience. The service together with the ambiance is beyond comparison to what we have seen else where.
If you’re not lucky enough to stay at this hotel - do the next best thing and go to the top and look across Singapore’s amazing skyline. You can see much from up there - it’s worth the money.
It is definitely a highlight of this hotel. Beautiful views of the city, relaxed and a great perk when you stay at the hotel

Bought a ticket & wen tup in the elevator. Unfortunately, we didn't realise that you needed a separate ticket to enter the bar/restaurant. That ticket had to purchassed at ground floor, an dit was too late by the time we were on the top of the building. Lose a start for that. Too be honest, the gardens were 100 times better.

Although it was a misty day when I visited the 'Skypark' because of Indonesia annual fire burning, I had a good view of Marina Bay and the surrounding areas including the 'Gardens by the Bay'. At this level there is no access to the bar. I would recommend paying extra and go to the bar a level higher where one can relax and enjoy the view with a drink or two specially if it a hot day. Please no not forget when buying ticket to mention that you are a senior citizen if you are. You will get discount and if you flew by Singapore Airline you get further discounts.

To get access to the Skypark you must go to the Sands Hotels. The Skypark ticket office is just by the side of the hotel. While the ticket for the Bar observation area is within the corridor of the hotel. It is fairly easy to find either.

Was it worth it? I think so for the sceneries. Choose a clear day if it is possible.

Although the views are amazing, the fact that there is no shade, nowhere to sit and limited space we were very disappointed. We understand that you need to encourage people to get through quickly and don’t want them hanging around too long it was not worth the money.

REVIEW_TITLE: Don’t bother with skypark, go to the bar on 57th floor
REVIEW_BODY: Didn’t go to skypark, which you have to pay to go on the viewing deck. Go to tower 3 and as to have a drink at Ce La Vi bar on the 57th floor (skypark is on 56). They charge you 22sgd to go up, but you get a voucher to spend those 22 on drinks. We had a pint of Stella for 21sgd++, which is only slightly more expensive than Clarke Quay for example. The view is fantastic. You can see the infinity pools but are not allowed to enter that area.

Firstly it is expensive. Secondly, the view isn’t the great and you can only walk around about half of top of Tower 3. The other areas are restricted to hotel guests.

Better scenery to just walk around the marina or garden by the bay.

Really wish we hadn’t gone.

A must see in Singapore. The view is magnificent - not to be missed at night. The restaurants on the top of the towers are incredibly delicious. If possible stay at the hotel and enjoy the amenities.
An architectural treasure.
Can see the whole Singapore from this roof top observation deck at the Marina Sands Hotel. Very nice place to take photos for great memory of visit to Singapore.
It was a beautiful opportunity to see the laser lights from the skypark. We spent the whole day and enjoyed the views so much. Definitely will return when I return to Singapore again

We visited Marina Bay Sands Sky Park Observation Deck

We experienced the most breathtaking and incredible 180degrees view of Singapore, we got there just after 8pm, on a Thursday evening, unfortunately we missed the Spectra light and water shows, but we still had an amazing time, it’s a shame though, restaurant is only accessible to hotel guests but there’s a small bar sells drink drink, we tried their Singapore Sling while enjoying the magnificent views.

We booked our tkts through Klook at a discounted price of £11.16, it’s definitely worth a visit to see the view of Singapore from 200 metres above the ground,

This amazing building is awesome to just look at from the bay, but up on the Skydeck fantastic views of Singapore.Buy tix in advance save $5
Brought mine at hotel &skip the line.
Golden bay sands was the best place to go 100% loved it and then down to the light by the bay show amazing. A must see to is Merlion amazing what is there not to love about Singapore.

Great shopping centre
Walking around mbs area.
Canal in the mall.
Lots of boutique and high end stores.

REVIEW_TITLE: Visit the Sky Bar Lounge, for Exquisite Cocktails And Liquour of yur Choice, with Commanding Vies of the City and Harbou
REVIEW_BODY: This is outstanding Sky-Bar, atop the Hotel Singapore Sands Marina Bay, decked on the Roof of this Unique Structure of this outstanding Super Premium Hotel in Singapore. They serve Excellent Hot Whole " Edamammee" Beans with their natural skin, and it is a Treat to peel one by one and relish the Unique Taste

REVIEW_TITLE: The hotel to stay when you want an unforgettable memory
REVIEW_BODY: The pool area and skypark are the architectural highlight of Asia. Staying here is so special, it is a real wonder how this view, feeling and delicious hotel and park were completed.
Very nice view but way too overpriced. I recommend the bar instead that has the same view and you can see the infinity pool too.

REVIEW_TITLE: Observation Deck with Marvellous View of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
A breathtaking observation deck just next to the infinity pool provide a spectacular birdeyes view of the wonders of Singapore.
There's a nice cafe joint for those who enjoy cupper coffee with the views.
